column1: Please provide your estimates for benchmark cover Trees and grass/grass like for Cumberland Plain Woodland PTC 849 (Grey Box - Forest Red Gum grassy woodland on flats of the Cumberland Plain, Sydney Basin Bioregion)
Note: this is using "cover" to mean the summed cover of all species in the plant lifeform type

column2: Indicate the lowest realistic value for each time step
column3: Indicate the highest realistic value for each time step
column4: Provide your best estimate of the value for each time step
column5: How confident are you that your interval, from lowest to highest, would capture the true value)

column2: Derived native grassland forms include many of the best remaining examples of this ecosystem; generally biodiversity declines associated with structure in this ecosystem have been associated with thickening of structure, either excess of trees (e.g. documented extinctions of grassy woodland specialist species during thick tree regeneration on NPWS reserves after exclusion of cattle) or encroachment of native or exotic shrubs. Lack of tree cover is not the biodiversity issue here and has been pursued through inappropriate management responses against expert land manager recommendations
